extendedInfo.description: A simple application to help you practice sight reading when you are away from your instrument.Practice mode gives you a stave and a single octave piano keyboard.  Notes are displayed in a random order and you have to play the correct key as quickly as possible.  Mistakes are highlighted in red until you press the correct key.  A continuous score for speed and accuracy is displayed.Examination mode is a sixty second challenge to see how well you are doing.  You are only given one chance at each note and you don't get your results until the end.Daily high scores from the exam mode are saved on the scores screen.

reviews.title: Best i ever tried
reviews.comment: The very best among the many i have tried. If you want to learn how to read a music score this is the perfect app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Simple and effective. Great for beginners or anyone looking to sharpen their note recognition while on the move. Looking forward to version 2!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I,m learning notes and this is a very good program for beginners to learn positions of notes
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Has helped me to memorize the notes. So easy to practice while I\'m waiting in line or anywhere.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: CWG
reviews.comment: simple & effective
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Very good app. Could be helpful if practice was split into 2 options: bass or treble clef.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Accidentally
reviews.comment: So how hard would it be to add sharps and flats. It is also quite confusing as an experienced musician to play higher notes on a keyboard when notes go lower on the stave, I know there are limitations to screen size.
reviews.author: Robert Kay

reviews.title: Great Free App
reviews.comment: The app is great, I only wish that when you select practice mode, it will allow you to choose treble or bass or even both.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Simple and effective
reviews.comment: Really nice simple app for learning notes.  Small improvement would be if it scaled to tablet screen size - but it\'s great on mobile.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Wonderful. Helps my fluency and is nice and simple though I wish it worked in landscape
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Great
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: It sucks
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wonderful Program
reviews.comment: Simple to use, very straight-forward, and now I can sight read much faster! Thanks for this app, good work!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good for beginners
reviews.comment: It\'s fine for people who are learning to read scores. It\'s just a Flash Card Test, but not a bad one. You can only do one note at a time though. Only useful to beginners.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Thanks for app.
reviews.comment: Very effective app. Does magic for me. Thanks again.
reviews.author: Brass Slowhand

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Simple and to the point
reviews.author: Chase Cabanillas

reviews.title: Nice app for piano, not for others.
reviews.comment: PROS: Good for piano; does not display the note names on the keys, so you translate directly from sheet to key position. Keeps scores.   CONS: The focus on piano makes it less usable for other instruments. There are no options whatsoever.
reviews.author: Arjen Kruithof

reviews.title: Nice except
reviews.comment: Its a good app but I can not finde middle c but it is a nice app I give it 5 stars (;
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Pls add the score and sound to keyboard. Great app, very useful.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: No sound
reviews.comment: There should be an option to play the sound of the pressed keyboard
reviews.author: A Google User
